intro: Moscharia, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, often fragrant flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. These plants typically thrive in wet or marshy environments, making them important components of wetland ecosystems. Moscharia species are native to various parts of Europe, Asia, and Africa. Their ability to grow in moist conditions makes them valuable indicators of wetland health and biodiversity.
